reasoning: Benign neonatal epilepsy occurs in approximately 1-4 per 1000 live births. The nonfamilial form represents a subset of benign neonatal epilepsy cases, estimated at ~25-50% of cases. Incidence approximately 1.5 per 100k person-years when annualized across general population. Confidence limited by heterogeneous definitions and incomplete epidemiological data in literature.
